Look at this verse from the Sixth Patriarch.
It brings out the marvel of consciousness and wisdom.
It's like pouring sweet dew down a burning, thirsty throat.
Such a profound observation.

source_sentence: 有何相宗不是參禪向上一路耶。
translation: Is there any aspect of the school that isn't the way up from participating in meditation?
I used to live in Wutai.
I dreamt I ascended to Tuṣita.
I personally saw Maitreya explaining consciousness-only.
"Discrimination is consciousness.
What's not discriminated is cognition.
Relying on consciousness is defiled ...
Relying on cognition, it's purified.
Defiled by consciousness there's birth and death.
Pure is the absence of buddhas.
This is how I came to understand the essence of consciousness-only.
Although this is dream talk, it can't be explained to a dreamer.
It shouldn't be explained to dreamers.
General Explanation of the Eight Consciousnesses Rule (Final)
